summary: This is an email chain from July 2019 discussing legal strategy in the Florida CVRA case related to Jeffrey Epstein. The emails involve attorneys coordinating a call and sharing updates on court filings, specifically regarding arguments about whether the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) with Epstein covers only Florida crimes or extends to other jurisdictions like New York.

persons.name: Marty Weinberg
persons.context: Epstein's attorney who filed a motion for a sur-reply in the Florida CVRA case, arguing for an opportunity to discuss the scope of the NPA.

persons.name: Judge Marra
persons.context: The judge presiding over the Florida CVRA case who is poised to rule on motions and requested a quick response.

connections.description: Weinberg is identified as Epstein's lawyer, filing motions on his behalf in the Florida CVRA case.

events.title: Jane Doe 1 and 2 filing in Florida CVRA case
events.description: Jane Doe 1 and 2 filed a recent filing (on Tuesday) in the Florida CVRA case, arguing that remedies must relate solely to Florida crimes and victims because the NPA only covers Florida.

events.title: Reply brief on remedies filed
events.description: The attorneys for Jane Doe 1 and 2 filed their reply brief on remedies, which should have brought all briefing on remedies for the CVRA violation to a close.

events.title: Motion for sur-reply filed by Weinberg
events.description: Epstein's lawyer Marty Weinberg filed a motion for a sur-reply, arguing for an opportunity to discuss the scope of the NPA among other things.

events.title: Planned opposition to Weinberg's motion
events.description: The attorneys plan to file an opposition on Monday to Weinberg's motion for extending the briefing further.

keyFacts: The legal argument centers on whether the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) with Jeffrey Epstein covers only Florida crimes or extends to other jurisdictions like New York.
Jane Doe 1 and 2 were told in 2013 that the NPA did not extend to New York or other jurisdictions, a point being made to Judge Marra.
Epstein's lawyer, Marty Weinberg, filed a motion for a sur-reply to discuss the scope of the NPA, indicating ongoing legal disputes over the agreement's reach.
Judge Marra is actively managing the case, requesting quick responses and being poised to rule rapidly on motions.
